private_information: I am allowed to move disks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G (A is smallest, G is largest in my set)
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves so final configuration is: left peg has (top->bottom) C D E F G H I J K L M N O P Q R S T, middle peg empty, right peg has (top->bottom) A B

private_information: I am allowed to move disks: H, I, J, K, L, M, N (H is smallest, N is largest in my set)
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves so final configuration is: left peg has (top->bottom) C D E F G H I J K L M N O P Q R S T, middle peg empty, right peg has (top->bottom) A B

private_information: I am allowed to move disks: O, P, Q, R, S, T (O is smallest, T is largest in my set)
agent_3.goal: Contribute moves so final configuration is: left peg has (top->bottom) C D E F G H I J K L M N O P Q R S T, middle peg empty, right peg has (top->bottom) A B

private_information: I will integrate per-agent primitive move lists and produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent plans and produce a correct PDDL domain and problem encoding the Tower of Hanoi instance and the target configuration for FastDownwards

public_information: Classic Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk may be moved at a time and a larger disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk.
There are three pegs: left, middle, right.
Disks are labeled A through T with A smallest and T largest.
Agents are restricted to moving only the disks explicitly assigned to them.
Goal configuration: left peg has top-to-bottom C D E F G H I J K L M N O P Q R S T, middle peg empty, right peg has top-to-bottom A B.

primitive_plan.system_prompt: You are agent_1 responsible for moving a specific subset of disks in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi instance. You must produce a sequence of primitive moves that only involve disks you are permitted to move.
primitive_plan.prompt: Your name is agent_1. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information} Your task is to contribute a list of primitive moves that you will perform. Provide an ordered list of moves in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves for disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G. Each move must respect Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not output PDDL. Keep the list minimal and precise so the orchestrator can integrate it.

primitive_plan.system_prompt: You are agent_2 responsible for moving a specific subset of disks in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi instance. You must produce a sequence of primitive moves that only involve disks you are permitted to move.
primitive_plan.prompt: Your name is agent_2. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information} Your task is to contribute a list of primitive moves that you will perform. Provide an ordered list of moves in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves for disks H, I, J, K, L, M, N. Each move must respect Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not output PDDL. Keep the list minimal and precise so the orchestrator can integrate it.

primitive_plan.system_prompt: You are agent_3 responsible for moving a specific subset of disks in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi instance. You must produce a sequence of primitive moves that only involve disks you are permitted to move.
primitive_plan.prompt: Your name is agent_3. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->agent_3->private_information} Your task is to contribute a list of primitive moves that you will perform. Provide an ordered list of moves in the exact format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves for disks O, P, Q, R, S, T. Each move must respect Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not output PDDL. Keep the list minimal and precise so the orchestrator can integrate it.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator expert. Integrate the primitive move lists provided by the agents into a single coherent plan and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure actions remain annotated or scoped per agent so execution assignments are clear.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You will receive the primitive ordered move lists from three agents. Their moves are simple strings like 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Use these to build a complete PDDL encoding of the Tower of Hanoi instance that matches the initial and goal configurations specified in the public information. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeted for the FastDownwards solver. Keep agent actions distinct and, if helpful, annotate which agent performs which move in action names or comments. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>.
